item.title: Report X-2025040810
item.description:
Report X-2025040810

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-05
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKKING HAZMAT IN OUTBOUND 6. USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSEE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE LEAKING PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF PACKAGE AND PACKAGE CONTENTS. 2 BOTTLES WAS SOLIDIFIED, NEUTRALIZED AND BAGGED 2 BOTTLES WERE BAGGED. CONTENTS OF BAGGED MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED AND ENTERED THROUGH THE DMP ETT SYSTEM.

The box was punctured by a forklift at BCH. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. ERTS generated waste ID: 232858-1

item.title: Report E-2025040350
item.description:
Report E-2025040350

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-24
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug in a box due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the jug being damaged. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. Four (1) impacted jugs were contained into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material, cardboard, and shrink-wrap and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040198
item.description:
Report E-2025040198

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-21
  • City: DOLTON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/21/25 @0130ct while unloading the trailer the warehouseman removed a pallet of drums and as he exited the trailer he heard a thud. When he looked back into the trailer he noticed that a 55 gallon drum from the pallet behind the one he had just removed had vallen over due to the pallet board breaking allowing the drum to tip over. The lid on the drum burst open allowing all the contents of the drum to be released into the trailer floor. The material ran to the back and out of the trailer into the containment in front of the dock. The release was contained to the trailer floor and the containment well at the dock. There was no contamination of soil or a water way. They immediately put down absorbent and called for a response team to assist with the clean up. The team showed up at 1300 and began to clean up the area with absorbents and placed them into the appropriate containers for disposal. They then pumped out the containment well @1430ct and did a final wipe down with absorbents. They were compete @1600ct.

item.title: Report X-2025040660
item.description:
Report X-2025040660

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: SAUK VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ARCBEST INTERNATIONAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Chris Zavala, 034 Operations Manager, contacted Safety regarding a UN3265 spill on the pallet located on the dock. Chris Zavala advised Brandon Nelson unloaded the freight and as was moving the freight down the dock. Chris Zavala stated Edgar Terrazas was also moving freight down the dock when Edgar Terrazas freight punctured the pallet Brandon Nelson was moving. Chris Zavala advised he received conflicting statements from both employees of who damaged the freight. Safety advised Chris Zavala CURA will be contacted for remediation. Chris Zavala requested straight time remediation. Chris Zavala advised the spill is contained and the jug is turned over on it's side to stop the spill. Ariana Lopez with CURA was contacted for remediation on straight time.

item.title: Report E-2025040223
item.description:
Report E-2025040223

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1730 ET, XPO-XLA notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 4-5oz of Clethodim 2e released from a plastic tote due to improper loading (strap rubbed on the tote causing a release). The release impacted the concrete dock and inside trailer#317-8081. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 to 5 ounces of UN1993 Clethodim 2e product released from the plastic tote due to a strap rubbing on the corner. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into (2) 200-gallon poly/UV totes due to the excess product. The old tote was triple rinsed and is now considered RCRA empty. Contractors placed impacted PPE in (1) 55-gallon metal drum and impacted oil dry in another (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025040146
item.description:
Report E-2025040146

item.title: Report E-2025040222
item.description:
Report E-2025040222

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: CREST HILL
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail in a box due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pail being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. One (1) 15-gallon poly drum and one (1) 5-gallon poly drum were used to containerize the product. An additional 5-gallon poly drum was used to contain fiber cardboard impacted waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE WEST PRIMKARY AT BAY 84. USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE LEAKING PACKAGES AND OTHER MATERIAL. PACKAGES AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF HAZMAT, CONTENTS WAS SOILED AND THEREFORE SOLIDIFIED. THE MATERIAL WAS BAGGED, MEASURED, WEIGHED AND INFORMATION WAS ENTERED INTO THE DMP/ETT SYSTEM.

item.title: Report E-2025040092
item.description:
Report E-2025040092

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0146 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XLA. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of V716-D was released from a 5-gallon bladder in a box due to improper loading by terminal XDP. The release impacted the inside of the box only in trailer # 3214991. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Called Chemtrec and spoke to John. Report #2025030700009.
